metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5288 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The crypt function in contrib/pgcrypto in PostgreSQL before 9.0.23, 9.1.xbefore 9.1.19, 9.2.x before 9.2.14, 9.3.x before 9.3.10, and 9.4.x before9.4.5 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (server crash) or readarbitrary server memory via a "too-short" salt.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5288` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.3.10-0ubuntu0.14.04
libecpg6 - 9.3.10-0ubuntu0.14.04
libpgtypes3 - 9.3.10-0ubuntu0.14.04
libpq5 - 9.3.10-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-9.3 - 9.3.10-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-client-9.3 - 9.3.10-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-contrib-9.3 - 9.3.10-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-plperl-9.3 - 9.3.10-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-plpython-9.3 - 9.3.10-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-plpython3-9.3 - 9.3.10-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-pltcl-9.3 - 9.3.10-0ubuntu0.14.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable and has been fixed, but no release version available for it (note: '9.1.19-0ubuntu0.14.04 ').
postgresql-9.3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.3.10-0ubuntu0.14.04').
